thread.title: How to Encourage More Women to Become, and Remain, Financial Planners

author: wsjcom
title: How to Encourage More Women to Become, and Remain, Financial Planners
text:
Judith McGee is chief executive and co-branch manager of McGee Wealth Management in Portland, Ore. Voices is an occasional feature of edited excerpts in which wealth managers address issues of interest to the advisory community. As told to Lynn Shattuck.
The percentage of women in the financial industry is low and hasn’t changed much in the past 20 years. Part of the reason is the industry’s reputation of not being a good fit for women, who often value flexibility or want to build a family.
